title: Jonah Hill WON'T star in The Batman movie after failing to agree deal to play the Penguin or Riddler
text:
He was reported to be in talks to star as either the Penguin or the Riddler in The Batman movie.

But it turns out that Jonah Hill will not be joining the highly anticipated project as the villain of the piece after all.

The actor, 35, passed on the film after failing to agree a deal with Warner Bros., according to Variety.

Passed: Jonah Hill will not be starring in The Batman after failing to reach a deal with Warner Bros. It had been reported he was in negotiations to play either the Penguin or the Riddler

Hill was most recently seen on the big screen in the comedy Beach Bum with Matthew McConaughey, released in March.

He also starred opposite Emma Stone in the 2018 Netflix series Maniac and released his directorial debut Mid90s in October last year.

It's not clear how the loss of Hill might affect the progress of The Batman which had been expected to begin production either at the end of this year or early in 2020.

Villain-less: It's not clear how the loss of Hill might affect the progress of The Batman which had been expected to begin production either at the end of this year or early in 2020

Caped Crusader: British actor Robert Pattinson, 33, is taking on the mantle of the Dark Knight in The Batman which is being written and directed by Matt Reeves

Just this week, Zoe Kravitz was confirmed to star as Catwoman opposite Robert Pattinson's Caped Crusader.

Geoffrey Wright is also on board to play Commissioner Gordon in the latest Gotham story to hit the big screen.

The Batman is being written and directed by Matt Reeves, who helmed Cloverfield, War for the Planet of the Apes and Dawn of the Planet of the Apes.

Reeves picked up the project after Ben Affleck decided to step down as both director and star after two outings as the Dark Knight in 2016's Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice and 2017's Justice League.

The Batman currently has a theatrical release date of June 25, 2021.
